sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. Thank you for starting your day with us. Here's a look at Wednesday's top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Soaring temperatures fuel devastating wildfires across Europe and shatter records in the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin says negotiations are moving forward on lifting a blockade on Ukrainian grain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And a decisive day for Italy, as Prime Minister Mario Draghi faces a confidence vote in Parliament. Wildfires continue to rage across Europe. A blaze on the outskirts of Athens has forced

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: people to evacuate. It began in tinder-dry vegetation at the foothill of Mount Penteli and quickly spread, whipped up by powerful winds. On Tuesday evening, about 78 firefighters assisted by 22 engines and 16 aircrafts, were trying to tame the fire, which was burning on two fronts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In the Gironde region of southwest France, two massive fires feeding on parched pine forests have also forced tens of thousands of locals to flee their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Summer vacation spots such as the famous Dune du Pilar, the tallest sand dune in Europe, have seen fires destroy campsites, bringing holidays to an abrupt end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The dune is behind us, the wood is charred, as we can see.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There is a landscape of desolation behind us and it will take time to find its beauty once again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Swirling winds and extreme heat have complicated firefighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One of the fires near Bordeaux is thought to have been started deliberately.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Spain, the battle to contain fires has taken place on several fronts, with northwest Zamora, Galicia and Costa del Sol now under control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Experts say the extreme heat and wildfires have come three weeks earlier than usual this year. In Portugal, cooling temperatures have eased the pressure on emergency crews even if more torrid weather is forecast for this Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Flames engulfed several homes on the outskirts of London on the day temperatures in the UK

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: exceeded 40 degrees Celsius for the first time since records began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The images have shocked policymakers and the public as buildings had to be evacuated after a grass fire spread to the properties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: An unknown number had to be taken to hospital, some suffering from smoke inhalation. But it wasn't the only blaze. There were numerous emergency calls to tackle fires in and around the capital, including the one at Wennington. London's fire brigade was forced to declare a major incident.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Well, I was sunbathing in my garden and then a massive black cloud come across.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I looked up, that side of Wembley Town was on fire and within an hour it spread all the way to our house.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So we've got a field outside our house that's on fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: All of our cars have gone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Several grassland areas in the south-east of England have caught fire, billowing smoke over major roads. The authorities are urging people to be vigilant and not to have barbecues as a precaution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Gironde, in France's southwest, has been engulfed by some of the biggest wildfires

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: this country has ever seen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Did you see, since we left, the number of kilometers we drove where both sides are burned?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It gives you an idea of the affected surface.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's huge for us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And what you have to understand is that there is not one fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There are at least two.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And each one of them, the one in Test-de-Vue or this one in Nandira, is the size of what we used to deal with over an entire summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: 20,000 hectares of forest have been destroyed so far. Aware of the magnitude of the problem, some locals have been taking matters into their own hands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We have watered the sides of the road to make sure the fire doesn't come back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: To save the forest, to save what hasn't been burned yet, to help as much as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Over 2,000 firefighters have been deployed to the region, but authorities say the elements have been against them so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And the fire remains out of control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The main challenge for these firefighters is the heat, but also the wind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It keeps changing the direction of the fire, forcing them to relocate multiple times every day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We fight fires every year, but this is very difficult to handle because it's everywhere.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We are everywhere at once. We try to be as fast and as efficient as we can.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But just now, we went to the other side and it started again here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: If we don't go around, there will be a new start over there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The work to put out the massive flames could be eased as temperatures are expected to drop over the next few days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And if the environmental impact on France's largest forest area will be felt for generations, so will the gratitude towards those who helped minimize the tragedy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Firefighters have done extraordinary work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They are heroes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The flames were as high as the pine trees and they were out 20 meters from my home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I was allowed to go back to check my animals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: I mean, I only have two chickens, nothing major, but they saved my chickens and my house.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Annelies Borges in the Gironde in the south-west of France for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Keeping cool is becoming a major preoccupation across Europe as the current heat wave spreads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Germany is already in the grip of high temperatures, with the west of the country scraping the 40 degree mark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Cologne, the authorities were prepared with a new water spray system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the Netherlands, people flocked to Hague Beach as temperatures reached record levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The country has just recorded its third hottest day ever. Experts blame climate change for this latest heat wave and warn worse is in store in years to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In Madrid, there's been a reminder of the dangers excessively hot weather can bring.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A second rubbish collector has died from heatstroke, triggering an intense debate in Spain about working conditions under extreme temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the U.K., the heat wave is disrupting rail travel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: As the country faces hottest ever day, all trains are canceled from London's King's Cross station, leaving travellers stranded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: I find that all the trains are cancelled due to heat, which I don't get it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They've got trains in Australia, they work, what's the problem here?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Belgian zoos are handing out ice lollies to the inmates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's part of special measures including frozen food and extra showers to protect the animals. Sri Lanka's acting president and former prime

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: minister Ranil Wickramasinghe is hoping to be confirmed as head of state when parliament meets today. However, it's not a foregone conclusion as two other politicians are vying for the job. The vote follows the resignation of former leader Gautam Bhai Rajapaksa after he fled the country last week over the island's worst ever economic crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At least 16 Democratic members of the US Congress have been arrested during a protest in support of abortion rights in front of the Supreme Court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The civil disobedience action was staged in the aftermath of the historic overturning of Roe v. Wade last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The politicians joined in chants, saying, Our bodies, our choice, and we won't go back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Bidens have welcomed Ukraine's First Lady, Olena Zelenska, to the White House ahead of her address to Congress. won't go back. Ukrainian women and children. The visit returns a surprise trip Jill Biden made to Kyiv last May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In a time of war, journalists are on the front line, and UNESCO says Ukraine is currently one

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: of the most dangerous countries in the world for them. Russia tried to stop independent journalism on occupied territory because they want to spread just propaganda, Russian propaganda, pro-Russian propaganda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: UNESCO has given journalists in Ukraine 125 protective gear kits, bulletproof vests and helmets to help keep them safe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Journalists are targets, TV stations are targets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: More than 10 TV towers were attacked in Ukraine, so the media infrastructure is also attacked.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Over 30 reporters have died in Ukraine since the start of the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: You're watching Good Morning Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Do stay with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
